channel.title: Sad tiem):
channel.description:
So i came across [url='https://www.worldstarhiphop.com/videos/video.php?v=wshhsYfiNfb0wfu50i12']this[/url] today, and I was shocked..
I knew agriculture farms, like these, were cruel. But like this? Wow..
What are your guys' opinion?
How many shits do you give?
Spill the beans boys, it's ok to show some feeling(:
...Faggots..[/SIZE]
Edit: And i fucking love eating meat.

item.title: Sad tiem):
item.dc:creator: Grief_Reaper
item.description:
I think in order to stop the cruel shit going on in industrial farms and other problems like overcrowding we need to lower the human population, I have three solutions:

  1. Everyone goes gay.

  2. War, famine all that good stuff.

  3. Selective breeding, that mean only the privlaged can have sexy time as from birth kids are castrated/nutered.

Personally I like 3.

Read full topic

DansonDelta40:

The real question is:

Would you give a fuck if it were humans being processed to food this way? Why would you, or why not? Same thing, different animal.

Simple. Eating humans is not conducive to the continuation of the species.

item.title: Sad tiem):
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Fancy Pants:

lmao obviously if this is still going on all those people haven’t made much of a difference.

bro if you keep bitching about factory farms im going to spend an entire paycheck on steaks and throw them out. it’s so annoying that i will literally waste money to spite everyone like you.

they have though

all i’m saying is don’t eat meat like there’s no tomorrow

eat within healthy limits and thats enough (i.e. not a 2 pound steak every day)

go right ahead though

Read full topic

item.title: Sad tiem):

item.description:
I have two quotes, one humorous, one serious:

“If God hadn’t intended us to eat other animals, why did he make them out of meat?”
“If God hadn’t intended us to eat other animals, why did he make us omnivores?”

Read full topic

item.description:

Read full topic

item.title: Sad tiem):
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
I do think that the handling of livestock should be regulated, and I’m also sure that there are quite a lot of major producers of meat that do not follow such guidelines. This will not stop me from eating meat though. I enjoy meat, and it is natural for humans to consume meat as part of their diet. I will not stop because someone feels I should feel guilty about this, or the cruelty of large producers.

If you ask me to support legislation for proper handling of livestock, I would agree. If you suggest funding for research towards synthetic meat I would agree. Just don’t ask me to give up meat or feel guilty about eating meat.

Read full topic

item.title: Sad tiem):
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
farm != industrial meat producing

and i fucking hate the attitude of “one person makes no difference”
news flash: it’s not just one person

meat production actually has declined as a result of less meat consumption (i.e. vegetarians + people who eat a reasonable amount of meat instead of huge amounts like most people)

Read full topic

item.title: Sad tiem):
item.dc:creator: CatzEyes93
item.description:
I have relatives that have chicken farms and pork farms. With my own eyes I did not see such stuff.

Pass the pork chops please?

Read full topic

item.title: Sad tiem):
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
I have actually worked on a couple meat producing farms. While I wouldn’t say that animals are treated ‘nice’, they weren’t treated nearly the way they show in some of the more disturbing vids.

However, I worked on smaller farms. I’m betting larger more industrialized farms are closer to that than we like to think about.

Read full topic

item.title: Sad tiem):
item.dc:creator: Fancy_Pants
item.description:
Fuskox:

I know that if I stopped eating meat, it would do nothing to stop any one the abusive farms, the only people who can stop that are the government or the owners of the farms.

but dont you know, if one person stops eating meat it makes such a giant difference in the conditions of factory farms!!! thats why theyre so good now!

Read full topic
